'Raf kinases' are a family of three serine/threonine-specific protein kinases
that are related to retroviral oncogenes. The
mouse sarcoma virus 3611 contains a Raf kinase-related oncogene that enhances
fibrosarcoma induction. RAF is an acronym for 'R'apidly 'A'ccelerated
'F'ibrosarcoma.

Raf kinases participate in the RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK signal transduction cascade,
also referred to as the mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) cascade. Activation of RAF kinases requires interaction with
RAS-GTPases.

The three RAF kinase family members are:
* A-Raf
* B-Raf
* C-Raf (Raf-1)
